# On-Call Decision-Making and Automation Bias

On-call engineers make decisions during system degradation,
often with limited time and incomplete information.

In this lab scenario:
- Engineers operate under stress
- AI is proposed to recommend actions
- Recommendations may influence decisions even when optional

Known operational characteristics:
- High cognitive load
- Urgency and uncertainty
- Immediate customer and system impact

Known risks:
- Automation bias under pressure
- Reduced willingness to challenge suggestions
- Blurred responsibility for outcomes

This document provides context only.
It does not recommend approving or rejecting AI assistance.
